description.plain:
Peter Gene Hernandez (born October 8, 1985), known by his stage name Bruno Mars, is an American singer-songwriter and record producer. He is also known for being the leader of the production team The Smeezingtons, which was organized in 2009.

Raised in Honolulu, Hawaii, by a family of musicians, Mars began making music at a young age and performed in various musical venues in his hometown throughout his childhood. He graduated from high school and moved to Los Angeles, California, to pursue a musical career.

His debut album Doo-Wops and Hooligans was released in 2010 with three hit singles. His second album, Unorthodox Jukebox, was released in 2012 and quickly reached the number one selling album in the U.S. at the time while spawning multiple hit singles of its own. On Friday, October 7th, 2016, he released the lead single and music video for “24K Magic,” from his third studio album of the same name.

In 2021, Mars and Anderson .Paak officially formed the R&B super-duo, Silk Sonic, as their debut album, An Evening with Silk Sonic, was released on November 12 of the same year.

Having sold over 100 million records in the short span of his career, Mars is one of the best-selling artists of all time. To date, he has had eight number-one singles on the Billboard Hot 100, including features. Plus, having started his career in 2010, he is the fastest artist to score five No. 1 hits since Memphis-based rockstar Elvis Presley.

body.plain:
Peter Gene Hernandez (born October 8, 1985), known by his stage name Bruno Mars, is an American singer-songwriter and record producer. He is also known for being the leader of the production team The Smeezingtons, which was organized in 2009.

Raised in Honolulu, Hawaii, by a family of musicians, Mars began making music at a young age and performed in various musical venues in his hometown throughout his childhood. He graduated from high school and moved to Los Angeles, California, to pursue a musical career.

His debut album Doo-Wops and Hooligans was released in 2010 with three hit singles. His second album, Unorthodox Jukebox, was released in 2012 and quickly reached the number one selling album in the U.S. at the time while spawning multiple hit singles of its own. On Friday, October 7th, 2016, he released the lead single and music video for “24K Magic,” from his third studio album of the same name.

In 2021, Mars and Anderson .Paak officially formed the R&B super-duo, Silk Sonic, as their debut album, An Evening with Silk Sonic, was released on November 12 of the same year.

Having sold over 100 million records in the short span of his career, Mars is one of the best-selling artists of all time. To date, he has had eight number-one singles on the Billboard Hot 100, including features. Plus, having started his career in 2010, he is the fastest artist to score five No. 1 hits since Memphis-based rockstar Elvis Presley.

songs.full_title: 24K Magic by Bruno Mars
songs.title: 24K Magic

description.plain:
“24K Magic” is a braggadocious party anthem described by Bruno Mars as an “invitation to the party” of his third album of the same name. It combines modern-referencing lyrics (like “#blessed”) with 80s-style production helmed by Shampoo Press & Curl and The Stereotypes.

https://twitter.com/BrunoMars/status/782882125506678784

The official video for the track dropped October 7, 2016. It’s the perfect complement to the party anthem, an opulent dance-fest, with Mars joined by an incredible looking squad living it up in Los Angeles and Las Vegas.

The song won the Grammy for “Record of the Year” at the 2018 Grammys held on January 28, 2018.

songs.full_title: Again by Bruno Mars
songs.title: Again

description.plain: “Again” is an unreleased song by Bruno Mars, which leaked online back in 2013. The song originally served as the demo version of Natasha Bedingfield’s song of the same name.
